content.raw:
Oh, silly me, autocython treats the extensions as out of date if setup.py changes...and I changed a comment in setup.py. I won't recompile the extensions, but I'll change the saved hashes (how it determines if the extensions are out of date) to reflect the new setup.py.

If compiling on windows were a matter of `conda install`ing a couple of packages, I'd be all for source-only repositories with compilation at first import. But not only are they not conda packages, the windows compiler for Python 3 is 5GB (the Python 2 one is a more respectable 80MB).
